author: gloslegofan
title: Funky 'cartoon' version of a classic London tourist favourite
review:
Box/Instructions

The box is the standard Pick-a-Model blister pack with 3 compartments. The pack is now pre-populated, you do not need to fill it from the Pick-a-Brick wall. This may disappoint some people (particularly youngsters), but I usually managed to miss out some vital piece from previous Pick-a-Model sets!

The instructions consist of 18 steps.

Parts

There are 44 pieces in total, none of which are particularly remarkable. The model costs £3.99 (correct as of October 2017), this makes the price per piece 9.1p.

The completed model

The Guardsman is very 'cartoonised' but instantly recognisable. There are accuracy issues - it could be argued that the buttons on the coat should be a different colour (perhaps yellow / gold), the cap is exaggerated, and they are holding a broom rather than a rifle! 

But who cares - it is a fun representation of the Queen's Guard.

Overall opinion

This is a great little set, exclusive to the Lego Leicester Square store, and definitely worth picking up if you visit London.
